instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: 820 2838 a dim green light
threads.message:
I guess this means <SIGNAL>SYS_ONE_WIRE</SIGNAL> is not working is this correct? 
I am also only getting 8.18V on <CAPACITOR>C7563</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, this is low right?

threads.title: 820 2838 a dim green light
threads.message:
Pin 8 of <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> is high too?
Liquid signs on board?
Check voltage on both pins of <RESISTOR>R4999</RESISTOR>.
Y5010 oscillates?
Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is correct.

threads.title: 820 2838 a dim green light
threads.message: SMC not running or in bypass mode. If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> is high and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> is high then there is probably crap under it.

threads.title: 820 2838 a dim green light
threads.message:
pin 5 <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> =3.41V
liquid signs around <CHIP>U4800</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>
Y5010 I think oscillates ever so slightly pin 1 1.5723V-1.5724V pin 2 1.5742V-1.5724V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is OL then says 3.1V-2.9 and goes back to OL again and back.
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> 3.41V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R5014</RESISTOR>=4.41V

threads.title: 820 2838 a dim green light
threads.message:
sorry I meant to type 3.41V
my apologies

threads.title: 820 2838 a dim green light
threads.message: So I should reball the smc?

threads.title: 820 2838 a dim green light
threads.message: Reflow, if no success reball, if no success replace. Or if you are smart and don't want to waste time replace immediately.
